text: The Book of Obadiah is the shortest book in the Old Testament. Which nation is its prophecy primarily directed against?
verseText: The vision of Obadiah. Thus says the Lord GOD concerning Edom...

text: Why was God pronouncing judgment against Edom?
options: For their pride and violence against their brother Jacob (Israel/Judah)
verseText: The pride of your heart has deceived you... Because of the violence done to your brother Jacob, shame shall cover you, and you shall be cut off forever.

text: What specific action did Edom take during Jerusalem's calamity that angered God?
options: They stood aloof and rejoiced over Judah's destruction, even looting
verseText: On the day that you stood aloof, on the day that strangers carried off his wealth and foreigners entered his gates and cast lots for Jerusalem, you were like one of them... you should not have rejoiced over the people of Judah in the day of their ruin...

text: What does Obadiah say about Edom's dwelling place that contributed to their pride?
options: Dwelling in the clefts of the rock, high habitation
verseText: The pride of your heart has deceived you, you who live in the clefts of the rock, in your lofty dwelling, who say in your heart, “Who will bring me down to the ground?”

text: Obadiah contrasts Edom's downfall with the future restoration of whom?
options: The house of Jacob and the house of Joseph (Israel)
verseText: But in Mount Zion there shall be those who escape, and it shall be holy, and the house of Jacob shall possess their own possessions. The house of Jacob shall be a fire, and the house of Joseph a flame, and the house of Esau (Edom) stubble...

text: What concept is mentioned in Obadiah 1:15 that signifies God's judgment on the nations?
verseText: For the day of the LORD is near upon all the nations. As you have done, it shall be done to you; your deeds shall return on your own head.

text: According to Obadiah, who will ultimately possess the kingdom?
options: Saviors from Mount Zion / The LORD
verseText: Saviors shall go up to Mount Zion to rule Mount Esau, and the kingdom shall be the LORD's.

text: Edom descended from which twin brother of Jacob (Israel)?
verseText: (Genesis identifies Esau as Jacob's twin and the ancestor of the Edomites).

text: What does God say He will make Edom among the nations?
verseText: Behold, I will make you small among the nations; you shall be utterly despised.

text: Even if Edom made its nest as high as what, God said He would bring them down?
verseText: Though you soar aloft like the eagle, though your nest is set among the stars, thence I will bring you down, declares the LORD.

text: Obadiah 1:5 compares Edom's coming destruction to thieves or grape gatherers. What is the point of the comparison?
options: The destruction will be partial, like thieves leaving some behind
The destruction will be total, unlike thieves/gatherers who leave some
The destruction will happen at night
verseText: If thieves came to you, if plunderers came by night— how you have been destroyed!— would they not steal only enough for themselves? If grape gatherers came to you, would they not leave gleanings?

text: Who does Obadiah 1:7 say will deceive and prevail against Edom?
options: Their own allies ('men at peace with you')
verseText: All your allies have driven you to your border; those at peace with you have deceived you; they have prevailed against you; those who eat your bread have set a trap for you; there is no understanding in him.

text: What will God destroy out of Edom on that day, according to Obadiah 1:8?
verseText: Will I not on that day, declares the LORD, destroy the wise men out of Edom, and understanding out of Mount Esau?

text: What specific location associated with Edom is mentioned in Obadiah 1:9?
verseText: And your mighty men shall be dismayed, O Teman, so that every man from Mount Esau will be cut off by slaughter.

text: Obadiah 1:12 lists several things Edom should NOT have done on the day of Judah's distress. Which is NOT listed?
options: Boasted in the day of distress
verseText: But you should not have gloated over the day of your brother in the day of his misfortune; you should not have rejoiced over the people of Judah in the day of their ruin; you should not have boasted in the day of distress.

text: What action related to Judah's wealth is condemned in Obadiah 1:13?
options: Entering the gate and looting ('gazing on disaster' and 'looting his goods')
verseText: You should not have entered the gate of my people in the day of their calamity; you should not have gloated over his disaster in the day of his calamity; you should not have looted his goods in the day of his calamity.

text: What did Edom do to the fugitives of Judah, according to Obadiah 1:14?
options: Stood at the crossroads to cut them off and hand them over
verseText: You should not have stood at the crossroads to cut off his fugitives; you should not have delivered up his survivors in the day of distress.

text: The principle 'As you have done, it shall be done to you' (Obadiah 1:15) is known as:
verseText: As you have done, it shall be done to you; your deeds shall return on your own head.

text: Obadiah 1:16 compares the nations drinking on God's holy mountain to what future action?
options: The nations continually drinking and swallowing, becoming as though they had never been
verseText: For as you have drunk on my holy mountain, so all the nations shall drink continually; they shall drink and swallow, and shall be as though they had never been.

text: Where will there be escape and holiness, according to Obadiah 1:17?
verseText: But in Mount Zion there shall be those who escape, and it shall be holy, and the house of Jacob shall possess their own possessions.

text: What materials are the houses of Jacob, Joseph, and Esau compared to in Obadiah 1:18?
verseText: The house of Jacob shall be a fire, and the house of Joseph a flame, and the house of Esau stubble; they shall burn them and consume them, and there shall be no survivor for the house of Esau, for the LORD has spoken.

text: Obadiah 1:19 describes the restored Israelites possessing territories. Who will possess Mount Esau?
verseText: Those of the Negeb shall possess Mount Esau...

text: According to Obadiah 1:19, who will possess the land of the Philistines?
verseText: ...and those of the Shephelah shall possess the land of the Philistines; they shall possess the land of Ephraim and the land of Samaria, and Benjamin shall possess Gilead.

text: The exiles of Israel will possess the land of the Canaanites as far as what northern city (Obadiah 1:20)?
verseText: The exiles of this host of the people of Israel shall possess the land of the Canaanites as far as Zarephath...

text: The exiles of Jerusalem who are in Sepharad will possess the cities of the what (Obadiah 1:20)?
verseText: ...and the exiles of Jerusalem who are in Sepharad shall possess the cities of the Negeb.

text: Who are the 'saviors' mentioned in Obadiah 1:21?
options: Deliverers/leaders arising from Zion to govern Edom
verseText: Saviors shall go up to Mount Zion to rule Mount Esau, and the kingdom shall be the LORD's.

text: What is the ultimate declaration about the kingdom in the final verse?
options: The kingdom shall be the LORD's
verseText: ...and the kingdom shall be the LORD's.
